attributes.action: re-evaluate the current regulations regarding the current body mass index levels for IVF treatment
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Being someone who suffers with infertility due to the fact of having two ectopic pregnancies, fibromyalgia, Arthritis, part of my bowel and bladder stuck down with adhesions and other medical conditions I have been refused IVF treatment on the NHS due to being overweight.
No one is prepared to accept the fact that having several severe health problems I am unable to lose as much weight as the current regulations are set at.
This needs to be changed and the BMI level needs to be raised from 30 to 35 to allow those people who are unable to conceive without help but also are unable to lose a lot of weight due to the fact they are unable to do a decent level of exercise due to their conditions get their chance of reaching a realistic goal of becoming healthier and being able to have the chance to become a parent with these new regulations in place.
Being offered a gastric band or an operation to remove one's stomach should not be offered as a matter of routine as I was.
